job_description:
WHO WE ARE

Welcome to one of Europe’s most exciting New Space companies, creating the world's first fully connected mesh network in the sky. We are an international team of experts and engineers who have spent their careers expanding the boundaries and potential of space, now united in pursuit of a single vision. We value trust, open communication and collaboration to achieve the best results together.

Now we are looking for the best talents for our locations in Munich and Berlin to help us make our vision come true.

YOUR MISSION

Working within the Space Segment Payload Technical team to ensure the Satellite Regenerative Payload functions, and related software, firmware are developed and qualified to meet Service requirements. You shall act as part of the Procurement team, keeping oversight on the Space Segment Prime Contractor(s).

This includes:

 * Space Segment procurement activities through Phase CDE
 * Focusing on the Onboard Processor functional, software and firmware aspects of the Telecommunication Payload
 * Following Regenerative Payload functional architecture, processing logic, development and validation, covering both Mission and Payload control
 * Support to the development and validation of the network and air interfaces, and Satellite Platform interfaces
 * Reviewing and giving guidance of all Payload Software and Firmware activities
 * Technical support to the System Level Engineering Team for related topics, such as:
   * System Validation and Operations
   * Network and Payload control
 * Supporting the generation and maintenance of related Interface Control Documents
 * Reviewing of verification approach and support to system level tests
 * Support to related Satellite technical topics
 * Support to definition and execution of in-orbit tests and operations
 * Visiting and reviewing Satellite Prime activities



WHAT YOU BRING ON THE TABLE



 * You should have a minimum experience of 10 years in the field of Satellite Systems development in Phase CD, focusing on Payloads functional and/or software design and development
 * Experience in related System Engineering activities such as requirements and interface management
 * In depth knowledge of Software and Firmware development for Satellite Payloads
 * Good verbal and written skills. Good team working is essential
 * Able to guide and control Satellite Prime and Payload supplier
 * Willingness to work flexibly and as necessary to achieve the goals on time
 * Excellent written and spoken English



WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

We are an international team of space enthusiasts, following one great vision. We value equality in our work environment where different opinions, backgrounds and experiences are not only welcomed but also necessary to achieve the best result collaboratively.
This permanent position was created recently and thus offers a lot of creative freedom. Our approach is to create a modern work environment with hybrid working model. We offer an attractive salary depending on your experience.

Rivada Space Networks is an equal opportunity employer with the approach to create a diverse and inclusive working environment. We therefore welcome applications from all qualified candidates irrespective of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age, disability, or other individual characteristics.

ABOUT US



Rivada Space Networks is deploying the first true “OuterNET™”: a global low latency point-to-point connectivity network of LEO satellites. By connecting our satellites with lasers, we will provide resellers and B2B customers with the ability to securely connect any two points on the globe with low latency and high bandwidth. The constellations, comprising 600 low-earth-orbit communications satellites, will represent a fundamental change in the availability of secure, global, end-to-end enterprise-grade connectivity for Telecom, Enterprise, Maritime, Energy and Government Services markets. Rivada Space Networks is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rivada Networks, Inc.
Rivada is working with Terran Orbital to manufacture and SpaceX to launch our satellites. The deployment starts in 2025 with full-service launch in 2026.

job_description:
* Code number: J000014561
 * Entry level: Professionals
 * Location: Ottobrunn
 * Organization: Porsche eBike Performance GmbH

TASKS

TASKSTASKS

 * Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders, including product managers, development and test teams, to elicit and document technical requirements and specifications. Driving technical requirements generation from business and product requirements
 * Classic System Requirements Analysis: Perform system requirements analysis based on stakeholder requirements and in coordination with system and software architects
 * Documentation: Document requirements at the system level and support departments in creating domain-specific requirements. Create comprehensive and detailed requirement documents, including specifications, use cases, and process flows
 * Communication: Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and development teams, ensuring clear and continuous communication throughout the project lifecycle
 * Coordination and Support: Organize and coordinate requirements reviews. Provide support in planning and estimating work packages concerning time and resource requirements for requirements engineering.
 * Requirements Baselines: Implement and manage requirements baselines
 * Quality Assurance: Work with Test and QA teams to ensure that requirements are testable and that testing plans align with requirement specifications
 * Stakeholder Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations. Facilitate meetings and workshops to gather feedback and discuss requirements.
 * Project Support: Provide ongoing support to project teams by ensuring clear requirements, assisting in troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that requirements are met.
 * Reporting: Regularly report on the progress of the processing in the project based on KPIs yet to be defined
 * Best Practices: Stay updated on industry best practices and methodologies related to requirements management and apply them to improve processes. Support the development and design of the requirements engineering process
 * Process Identification: Identify and introduce necessary requirements management processes, tools, and development methods for R&D departments
 * Project-Specific Requirements Engineering: Take responsibility for project-specific requirements engineering in development projects
 * Technical Changes: Coordinate and manage technical changes
 * Infrastructure Creation: Create tool-based and project-specific infrastructure

QUALIFICATIONS

QUALIFICATIONSQUALIFICATIONS

 * Bachelor’s degree or higher education in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in Systems Engineering, Requirements Management or similar position
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 * Experience with best practices for writing requirements (INOSE, EARS, etc.)
 * Proficiency in requirements management tools (DOORS, Jama, etc.)
 * Experience with process assessment and lifecycle standards (ISO 33004, ISO 12207, ISO 15288, ASPICE, etc.)
 * Experience with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and V-model processes.
 * Ability to manage multiple priorities for multiple projects simultaneously.
 * Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with cross-functional teams.
 * Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and accuracy.
 * Bonus points:
   * Experience with e-bike or automotive industry projects.
   * Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools.
   * Certified in requirements management or business analysis (CBAP, PMI-PBA, etc.).
   * Experience with Model Based System Engineering Requirements Generation.
   * German language skills are an advantage.

AT A GLANCE

AT A GLANCEAT A GLANCE

At the headquarters in Ottobrunn near Munich, the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH develops, produces and markets advanced drive systems for two brands: FAZUA with the focus on pioneering compact lightweights for agile e-bikes and under the brand name Porsche exceptionally powerful drive systems. FAZUA is a young, ambitious brand that has transformed the cycling industry in 2017 with its innovative drive system for agile, compact, lightweight (and extremely good looking) e-bikes. Since July 2022, we are a part of the Porsche eBike Performance GmbH. Our diverse, open-minded, ambitious (and fun) team is constantly seeking new, inspiring talents who will help us push boundaries to shape the future of e-bike technology.

EXCLUSIVE LOOK BEHIND THE SCENES

EXCLUSIVE LOOK BEHIND THE SCENESEXCLUSIVE LOOK BEHIND THE SCENES

 * We are a diverse and international team of creative minds, passionate bike nerds, and progressive thinkers
 * You will see your ideas taking shape quickly: bring in your thoughts, challenge the status quo and see innovations being implemented soon
 * We offer a hybrid working model depending on the position.
 * You will find everything you need to work at our company headquarters in Ottobrunn just outside Munich: beautiful rooms, fully equipped kitchens, a huge terrace - and of course the best colleagues
 * Our location in the jaw-dropping Bavarian landscape offers a fantastic surrounding for rides. Take the chance to lease your dream bike on JobRad or simply grab one of our test bikes if available
 * We try to live sustainability in everything we do – instead of just talking about it
 * We are supportive of further education and foster ambitions of growth within the company
 * We believe in regeneration and agility. Therefore, we offer 30 days of vacation for you to fuel up and find new inspiration

HOW TO APPLY?

HOW TO APPLY?HOW TO APPLY?

Do you want to become part of the Porsche eBike Performance team? Please upload your CV and a short motivation letter including your availability and salary expectation.

CONTACT

CONTACTCONTACT

Your contact person: Dennis Ebeling

Mobile: +49 (0) 152 02052208




Apply now at: https://porsche-ep.jobs.personio.com/job/1849833?language=de&display=en: https://porsche-ep.jobs.personio.com/job/1849833?language=de&display=en

job_description:
* Experience (non-internship) in professional software development
 * Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems
 * Experience programming with at least one software programming language

In Amazon Product Knowledge Team, we want to build a comprehensive schematic and semantic constructs that allows us to understand customer’s intent to provide an experience that feel targeted to their shopping missing. It expands beyond factual product characteristics (e.g. resolution of a TV) to the product characteristics our customer’s use in their shopping missions – what the product is used for (e.g. baby-proofing), where the product is used (e.g. kitchen), who uses the product (e.g. teenager), when the product is used (e.g. thanksgiving) and opinions about the product (e.g. cute t-shirt). We build scalable solutions that are partially or entirely powered by AI and ML to discover Product Knowledge by mining customer engagements (e.g. search queries, customer reviews, web pages … etc.).
We have multiple positions for Software Engineers who are excited to work in big data challenges. We are looking for engineers to come up with design and build necessary platforms and solutions to enable various data science and analytics capabilities including; web scale ontology creation, entity recognition, improving data quality, natural language processing, discovery of new relationships along with its semantic, knowledge inferencing and enhancement to support strategic and tactical decision-making.
Our engineers are free to choose the most cutting-edge technologies to meet the requirements. Some of the technologies we use in our existing systems include NoSQL databases like DynamoDB, SWF, Elastic Search etc. It is an opportunity to closely work with and learn from Senior and Principal engineers across different Orgs.
Our software engineers work closely with data and applied scientists to build state of the art solutions to automatically aggregate and produce high quality data and knowledge. Our solutions provide the necessary guidance on how to identify and address products gaps along with semantic relationships between products everywhere on earth. Also our engineers work in partnerships with teams across Amazon to make sure we create benefits to our customers.

As a Software Development Engineer in the team, you will have the opportunity of solving challenging technical problems and working across multiple engineering teams, UX designers, and an international team of Ontologists/Taxonomists. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and operating massively distributed systems, big data systems and web services. Technologies involved include graph and NoSQL databases, Java, JavaScript, ReactJS, Elastic Computing and more. This role has a number of opportunities for cross-team ownership and cross-organizational technical leadership to create end-to-end solutions.


 * Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
 * Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

job.description:
• Experience (non-internship) in professional software development
  • Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems
  • Experience programming with at least one software programming language
In Amazon Product Knowledge Team, we want to build a comprehensive schematic and semantic constructs that allows us to understand customer’s intent to provide an experience that feel targeted to their shopping missing. It expands beyond factual product characteristics (e.g. resolution of a TV) to the product characteristics our customer’s use in their shopping missions – what the product is used for (e.g. baby-proofing), where the product is used (e.g. kitchen), who uses the product (e.g. teenager), when the product is used (e.g. thanksgiving) and opinions about the product (e.g. cute t-shirt). We build scalable solutions that are partially or entirely powered by AI and ML to discover Product Knowledge by mining customer engagements (e.g. search queries, customer reviews, web pages … etc.).
We have multiple positions for Software Engineers who are excited to work in big data challenges. We are looking for engineers to come up with design and build necessary platforms and solutions to enable various data science and analytics capabilities including; web scale ontology creation, entity recognition, improving data quality, natural language processing, discovery of new relationships along with its semantic, knowledge inferencing and enhancement to support strategic and tactical decision-making.
Our engineers are free to choose the most cutting-edge technologies to meet the requirements. Some of the technologies we use in our existing systems include NoSQL databases like DynamoDB, SWF, Elastic Search etc. It is an opportunity to closely work with and learn from Senior and Principal engineers across different Orgs.
Our software engineers work closely with data and applied scientists to build state of the art solutions to automatically aggregate and produce high quality data and knowledge. Our solutions provide the necessary guidance on how to identify and address products gaps along with semantic relationships between products everywhere on earth. Also our engineers work in partnerships with teams across Amazon to make sure we create benefits to our customers.

As a Software Development Engineer in the team, you will have the opportunity of solving challenging technical problems and working across multiple engineering teams, UX designers, and an international team of Ontologists/Taxonomists. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and operating massively distributed systems, big data systems and web services. Technologies involved include graph and NoSQL databases, Java, JavaScript, ReactJS, Elastic Computing and more. This role has a number of opportunities for cross-team ownership and cross-organizational technical leadership to create end-to-end solutions.

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
  • Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

job_description:
Mobileye is seeking for a Customer Support Engineer to assist leading automotive companies (OEMs) in deploying Mobileye products. This role involves analyzing complex systems and collaborating with development teams to drive effective solutions.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB LOOK LIKE?

 * Act as the technical liaison for platform software issues
 * Analyze and troubleshoot system problems, including Ethernet, sensor connectivity, software updates, and vehicle communication
 * Collaborate with Mobileye SW teams, suppliers, and customers to resolve issues
 * Support the development of innovative automotive products, including autonomous vehicle





ALL YOU NEED IS:

 * Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in system debugging/testing in the automotive industry
 * Knowledge of vehicle topology and ECU system architecture
 * Strong skills in Ethernet communication, CANFD, ETH, SOMEIP, and tools like CANoe
 * Strong experience in Ethernet communication and service-oriented architecture
 * Willing to travel within Germany/Europe
 * Proficient in English





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 * 5-7 years of experience in automotive system/SW/validation, preferably with ADAS products
 * Experience with multi-SOC ECUs, AUTOSAR, and network management
 * Advanced debugging skills for field issues

job_description:
ABOUT US:-

At Total IT Global, we elevate your digital journey with cutting-edge innovation, to achieve your vision of ‘the enterprise of the future’. We have a comprehensive portfolio of hardware and managed IT services for digital workplaces and data centres. We partner with high-growth enterprises to guide them through complex digital transformations with a consultative approach, offering customised solutions and services for all their business needs, across the entire IT asset life cycle.

Constant innovation and service excellence continue to position Total IT Global as a Digital Experience Enabler at the leading edge of innovation.”

Functions include:

 * Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.

 * Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills

 * Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.

 * Provide first level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.

 * Work with Third Party Vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.

 * Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.

 * Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.

 * Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.

 * Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.

 * Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.

 * Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.

 * Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral equipment.

 * Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software.

 * Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms.

 * This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.

 * Provide L1 support to non‐network attached printers.

Job Type: Full-time

Application Question(s):

 * Will you now on in future require sponsorship?

Experience:

 * Desktop Support: 1 year (Required)

Language:

 * German (Required)

Work authorization:

 * Germany (Required)

job_description:
About Munich Electrification
Munich Electrification is an innovative company founded with the aim of accelerating the transition to electric and connected mobility. We develop innovative electronic control units for electric vehicles for our global customers. Our international team is composed of highly motivated and exceptional engineers. We offer a relaxed and friendly work atmosphere with flat hierarchies. As a small and specialized team we are well-aware of the importance of each individual colleague and support and promote each employee according to their abilities and needs. Our office with adjacent prototype and testing lab is located in the heart of Munich at the Heimeranplatz. Learn more about us on our website.


Your Role


Munich Electrification is seeking a dynamic and motivated IT Admin/Engineer to join our growing team. This role provides an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of IT. The selected candidate will work closely with our IT to assist in troubleshooting and resolving network issues, monitoring and maintaining IT infrastructure, and contributing to various IT-related projects.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Troubleshoot and resolve network issues, including connectivity and performance problems.
 * Monitor and maintain IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and security systems.
 * Set up and configure laptops and desktops for new employees.
 * Troubleshoot and resolve IT problems reported by end-users.
 * Install, upgrade, and maintain software applications.
 * Manage user accounts and access controls.
 * Document and update IT procedures and user guides.
 * Assist with maintaining IT inventory and asset management.
 * Implement and support IT policies and procedures.


YOUR PROFILE

 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
 * Proven experience as an IT Admin/Engineer or similar role.
 * Strong understanding of IT hardware and software.
 * Proficiency in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.
 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 * Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
 * Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies.



Preferred Skills:
 * Knowledge of IT security practices and experience implementing security measures.
 * Experience in managing and optimizing cloud infrastructures like AWS and Google.
 * Familiarity with the Atlassian toolchain, including Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket.
 * Proficiency with Windows/Linux operating systems.
 * Strong knowledge of networking concepts and experience with network troubleshooting.

What we offer
The chance to be part of a highly innovative, agile, and unique team with the most prestigious customers in the automotive sector. You will gain a deeper knowledge around connected & electric vehicle batteries, battery management and electronics development. Strive in an exciting working environment, experience various inspiring team events, benefit from an adequate and competitive compensation, flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home. In our office we supply all employees with a healthy lunch and fresh snacks everyday.


We additionally offer our permanent full-time employees, among other benefits:
 * Free access to the fitness center right next to us
 * Public transport ticket for Munich
 * Bike-Leasing via Business Bike

job_description:
München / Nürnberg / Stuttgart / Berlin / Hamburg / Köln

Für interessante und spannende Projekte bei unseren Kunden suchen wir qualifizierte und kommunikationsstarke Mitarbeiter mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich Softwaretest. Du trägst als Test Engineer maßgeblich zum Erfolg unserer Testprojekte bei, indem Du einen Unterschied hinsichtlich der Softwarequalität bei unseren Kunden machst. Deine Verantwortung erstreckt sich von der Planung und Konzeption der Tests über die Ausführung und Dokumentation bis hin zur Testautomatisierung. Du kannst Dich im Rahmen von Continuous Delivery / Continuous Integration kreativ in technische Lösungen einbringen und lernst verschiedenste Infrastrukturen und Tools kennen.

Deine vielfältigen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben

 * Auswertung und Analyse von Anforderungen zur Erreichung einer hohen Testabdeckung
 * Ableitung von Testfällen anhand von Produktspezifikationen
 * Entwicklung von Teststrategien
 * Manuelle Testdurchführung und Testautomatisierung
 * Analyse und Erfassung von Fehlern im gesamten Produkt
 * Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Businessanalysten und Entwicklern
 * Reporting an das Test- und Projektmanagement
 * Beratung und Coaching unserer Kunden im Testprozess

Darauf legen wir Wert

 * Fundierte Erfahrung im Einsatz als Tester in Softwareprojekten
 * Abgeschlossenes Studium in der IT oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
 * Zertifizierung nach ISTQB® als Certified Tester Foundation Level
 * Praxis im Umgang mit Testwerkzeugen wie HP ALM, Jira, Testrail, Silk Test, etc.
 * Erfahrungen im Umfeld einer agilen und klassischen Softwareentwicklung
 * Bereitschaft in unseren Kundenprojekten Verantwortung für den Erfolg der Software Qualität zu übernehmen
 * Kundenorientiertes Auftreten sowie strukturierte und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise
 * Lernbereitschaft, Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsstärke
 * Du kannst Sachverhalte sowohl in Deutsch als auch Englisch verständlich darstellen
 * Generelle Reisebereitschaft ist vorhanden

Wünschenswert

 * Eine Zertifizierung nach ISTQB® als Agile Tester Foundation Level
 * Eine Zertifizierung nach ISTQB® im Advanced Level
 * Erste Erfahrung mit Testautomatisierungstools wie Tricentis Tosca®, Selenium, SoapUI/ReadyAPI
 * Erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Test Automation, Testdaten- sowie Umgebungsmanagement

Das erwartet Dich bei uns

 * Du bist bei uns ein wertvoller Mensch und keine Ressource
 * Werde Teil der up¯solut Mentalität
 * Eine spannende, kreative und abwechslungsreiche Aufgabe
 * Forderung und Förderung deiner Entwicklung
 * Attraktive und leistungsbezogene Vergütung
 * Ein neutraler Firmenwagen zur privaten Nutzung
 * Familiäre und offene Atmosphäre
 * Flexibles Homeoffice
 * Betriebliche Krankenversicherung und Altersvorsorge
 * Umfangreiche Corporate Benefits
 * Firmenevents

Wir freuen uns up¯solut auf Dich!

Sprich mit uns über das, was Dich bewegt. Und über das, was Du bewegen willst.

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit

Gehalt: 40.000,00€ - 100.000,00€ pro Jahr

Arbeitszeiten:

 * Montag bis Freitag

Leistungen:

 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
 * Betriebliche Weiterbildung
 * Erfolgsbeteiligung
 * Firmenevents
 * Firmenhandy
 * Firmenwagen
 * Flexible Arbeitszeiten
 * Homeoffice-Möglichkeit
 * Kostenlose Getränke
 * Kostenloser Parkplatz
 * Mitarbeiter-Rabatt

Sonderzahlung:

 * Zusatzzahlungen

Möglichkeit zu pendeln/umzuziehen:

 * 81829 München: Problemlos pendeln oder Bereitschaft, mit Unterstützung durch den Arbeitgeber umzuziehen (Wünschenswert)

Bewerbungsfrage(n):

 * Welche Gehaltsvorstellung haben Sie?

Berufserfahrung:

 * Softwaretest: 2 Jahre (Erforderlich)

Sprache:

 * Deutsch (Erforderlich)

Reisebereitschaft:

 * 75 % (Wünschenswert)

Arbeitsort: Zum Teil im Homeoffice in 81829 München

München / Nürnberg / Stuttgart / Berlin / Hamburg / Köln

Für interessante und spannende Projekte bei unseren Kunden suchen wir qualifizierte und kommunikationsstarke Mitarbeiter mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich Softwaretest. Du trägst als Test Engineer maßgeblich zum Erfolg unserer Testprojekte bei, indem Du einen Unterschied hinsichtlich der Softwarequalität bei unseren Kunden machst. Deine Verantwortung erstreckt sich von der Planung und Konzeption der Tests über die Ausführung und Dokumentation bis hin zur Testautomatisierung. Du kannst Dich im Rahmen von Continuous Delivery / Continuous Integration kreativ in technische Lösungen einbringen und lernst verschiedenste Infrastrukturen und Tools kennen.

Deine vielfältigen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben

  • Auswertung und Analyse von Anforderungen zur Erreichung einer hohen Testabdeckung
  • Ableitung von Testfällen anhand von Produktspezifikationen
  • Entwicklung von Teststrategien
  • Manuelle Testdurchführung und Testautomatisierung
  • Analyse und Erfassung von Fehlern im gesamten Produkt
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Businessanalysten und Entwicklern
  • Reporting an das Test- und Projektmanagement
  • Beratung und Coaching unserer Kunden im Testprozess

Darauf legen wir Wert

  • Fundierte Erfahrung im Einsatz als Tester in Softwareprojekten
  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in der IT oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung

Share
Zentrale
München
Apply now
Summary
Junior
Vollzeit
Festanstellung
About this job
CHECK24 is one of the leading online companies and Germany´s largest comparison portal. And we continue to grow - with you.

In our new football app, we offer millions of fans the perfect platform to express and share their passion for the sport. We combine an innovative prediction game, comprehensive game data, an active community, and a club finder that shows you where to watch your team on TV for the best price – the digital home for true football enthusiasts. As a QA Engineer, you will be responsible for securing and improving the quality of our application.

We look forward to receiving your application for the position of Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d) - Football at CHECK24 in Munich.
Your Qualifications
Education: You have successfully completed a university degree, ideally with a focus on IT
Experience: Initial experience in testing web applications or software, with knowledge of testing methods and tools being an advantage for you
Eye for detail: Through your high quality awareness and logical thinking, you identify the opportunities for improvement
Willingness to learn: You like to challenge proposed solutions and are continuosly eager to further develop yourself
Language skills: Fluent in English and German (with a minimum competency of B2 level in German)
Your Responsibilities
Small and cross-functional teams: Within our agile team you will be responsible for the quality assurance and systematically and regularly check our web applications and software on various devices to ensure a flawless function
Manual and automated testing: You will gain a deep understanding of the application and the requirements from a customer perspective
Close collaboration with the product management: You will play a central role in the release of new features and take responsibility for the design, planning and execution of tests
Your Benefits
Experience and stability: More than 15 years of successes and failures shared across the group in over 15 locations
Working with customer orientation: Each division at CHECK24 acts largely independently and unconditionally oriented towards its customers. This means focus and working methods like in a start-up with small teams and without superfluous coordination
Modern working: Flexible working hours model with a fair mobile working arrangement
Environment that demands and promotes openness and willingness to learn: You take responsibility in your team right from the start. If your ideas make our products better, we will adopt them. You know a tool that makes us better as a team? We will implement it together with you
We'll help you get ahead: Together with you, your manager is responsible for your personal development in your daily work. For this purpose, we offer trainings especially designed for our employees, such as the deepening of your IT skills
We value your commitment: Permanent contracts and attractive compensation with annual bonuses for special successes. Vouchers for numerous CHECK24 products, a subsidized company pension plan up to special conditions in fitness studios and a subsidized MVV ticket
Food & Drinks: In addition to our Checkito Lunches, cereals, regional fresh fruit and a wide range of coffee and drinks are provided to you
Checkito-Spirit: We know that only excellent teams develop excellent online products. That's why events to celebrate and network as well as our legendary summer and Christmas parties are part of our daily work routine
Contact
Natja Scheffler
natja.scheffler@check24.de
Send us applications only through our online application form, please.
Apply now

job_description:
WE WANT YOU!

Wir sind ein modern geführtes Beratungshaus mit Sitz in München. Als mittelständisches Unternehmen helfen wir unseren Kundinnen und Kunden, moderne IT für den effizienten, schnellen und hochwertigen Informationsaustausch zu nutzen. Technologisch am Puls der Zeit, fachlich stets einen Schritt voraus und mit einem hoch motivierten Team, in dem auch der Spaß nie zu kurz kommt.

Als erfolgreiches Unternehmen legen wir besonderen Wert auf vertrauensvolle und langfristige Beziehungen mit unseren Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern sowie Kundinnen und Kunden. Wir bieten spannende Aufgaben, persönliche Weiterbildung und attraktive Vergütungsmodelle in einem kreativen Umfeld.






Du möchtest nach dem Studium durchstarten und automatisierte Prozesse für unsere Softwareentwicklung und Cloud-Infrastruktur entwickeln? Deine Leidenschaft ist die IT, du bist ein offener, kommunikativer Mensch und hast Lust in einem dynamischen Team zu arbeiten?
Welcome on planet brainsphere!

DEINE AUFGABEN:

 * Entwurf, Implementierung und Wartung von Continuous Integration und Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)-Pipelines
 * Automatisierung von Softwarebereitstellungsprozessen und Systemwartung
 * Überwachung der Systemleistung und Implementierung von Skalierungsstrategien
 * Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklungsteams, um die Integration von DevOps-Praktiken zu fördern
 * Identifizierung und Behebung von Engpässen und Fehlern in der Softwarebereitstellung
 * Kontinuierliche Verbesserung und Optimierung der DevOps-Prozesse

DEIN PROFIL:

 * Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Informationstechnologie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
 * Interesse an der Implementierung von DevOps-Praktiken und -Werkzeugen
 * Interesse an der Automatisierung von Softwarebereitstellungsprozessen (z.B. Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes)
 * Verständnis von Cloud-Computing-Plattformen und -Diensten
 * Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu analysieren und effektive Lösungen zu entwickeln
 * Teamfähigkeit und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
 * Gute bis sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie idealerweise gute Englischkenntnisse

WIR BIETEN:




 * Innovative Projekte in einem spannenden Umfeld
 * Eine einzigartige Teamatmosphäre
 * Flache Hierarchien und die Möglichkeit, Ideen & Prozesse mitzugestalten
 * Überdurchschnittliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
 * Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag
 * Ein attraktives Leistungspaket aus Grundgehalt, Bonusprogrammen und kontinuierlicher Weiterentwicklung
 * Ein Büro mit Wohlfühlfaktor in zentraler Lage

job_description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

Our mission at Avelios is to build the leading software platform for the data-driven digitization of hospitals and patient care. To do so, we have built a modular software platform that digitizes and optimizes workflows in hospitals with cutting-edge technology in a user-friendly way. With our software, we enable hospitals, doctors & nurses to provide their patients with the best possible care.

To continue to shape the future of healthcare, we are looking for a (Senior) DevOps Engineer as a key member of our DevOps team. Your focus will be on rolling out and operating our software in clinics and in a cloud-based environment.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Work directly with our core development team
 * Design, test, deploy and maintain Avelios infrastructure
 * Work on large scale deployments
 * Work on cutting edge technology in medicine
 * Use best practices in monitoring and incident response
 * Develop ideas to improve usability and performance

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

 * Studies in Informatics or Computer Science from a top university or equivalent practical experience
 * Experience in Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Linux
 * Experience with modern toolchains
 * Interest in learning new technologies
 * Fluency in German or English

YOUR BENEFITS

 * A flexible as well as results-oriented working environment and trust-based working hours
 * A variety in your tasks and the opportunity to take ownership
 * An international, informal team structure in a motivating start-up atmosphere, allowing you to participate directly in our customer growth story and the overall success of Avelios
 * Ability to gain valuable hands-on experience in a startup backed by top European VCs
 * Attractive salary and virtual company shares
 * A monthly meal allowance up to 75 euros, the cost coverage of the Germany ticket (Deutschlandticket), and other additional benefits, such as UrbanSportsClub membership, a bike leasing program and corporate benefits

Apply for this job

ABOUT US

Working at Avelios means having a direct impact on improving our healthcare system and the quality of patient care. Our software is being used by doctors and nurses to treat patients in the best hospitals in Germany. We are growing fast and want to keep expanding our team and business to fundamentally digitize healthcare for the better. We appreciate different backgrounds and see diversity as one of our strengths.

Are you a talented, ambitious and impact-driven individual who wants to make a difference? Then what are you waiting for, apply now and join our team!
job_description_html:
About this role
Our mission at Avelios is to build the leading software platform for the data-driven digitization of hospitals and patient care. To do so, we have built a modular software platform that digitizes and optimizes workflows in hospitals with cutting-edge technology in a user-friendly way. With our software, we enable hospitals, doctors & nurses to provide their patients with the best possible care.

To continue to shape the future of healthcare, we are looking for a (Senior) DevOps Engineer as a key member of our DevOps team. Your focus will be on rolling out and operating our software in clinics and in a cloud-based environment.
Your Responsibilities
  • Work directly with our core development team
  • Design, test, deploy and maintain Avelios infrastructure
  • Work on large scale deployments
  • Work on cutting edge technology in medicine
  • Use best practices in monitoring and incident response
  • Develop ideas to improve usability and performance
Your Qualifications
  • Studies in Informatics or Computer Science from a top university or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience in Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Linux
  • Experience with modern toolchains
  • Interest in learning new technologies
  • Fluency in German or English
Your Benefits
  • A flexible as well as results-oriented working environment and trust-based working hours
  • A variety in your tasks and the opportunity to take ownership
  • An international, informal team structure in a motivating start-up atmosphere, allowing you to participate directly in our customer growth story and the overall success of Avelios
  • Ability to gain valuable hands-on experience in a startup backed by top European VCs
  • Attractive salary and virtual company shares
  • A monthly meal allowance up to 75 euros, the cost coverage of the Germany ticket (Deutschlandticket), and other additional benefits, such as UrbanSportsClub membership, a bike leasing program and corporate benefits
Apply for this job
About us

Working at Avelios means having a direct impact on improving our healthcare system and the quality of patient care. Our software is being used by doctors and nurses to treat patients in the best hospitals in Germany. We are growing fast and want to keep expanding our team and business to fundamentally digitize healthcare for the better. We appreciate different backgrounds and see diversity as one of our strengths.

Are you a talented, ambitious and impact-driven individual who wants to make a difference? Then what are you waiting for, apply now and join our team!

highlightSummary.sentence: organised team structure
Over time, they introduce additional benefits such as urban sports subscription or reimbursements for public transportation.
Lots of work from day one, not much room to learn or adjust.
I guess it's suitable for working students as they will get to work on lots of different tasks without feeling too much pressure
